tool.name: msmetadata
tool.shortdescription: Operations to retrieve metadata from a measurment set
tool.description:
The msmd tool provides methods to retrieve metadata from measurement sets.
\medskip\noindent\textbf{Attaching to a Measurement Set}
The simplest and most common way to attach an msmd tool to a measurement set is to use the msmd.open method which requires that you specify the name of the measurement set table.
NOTE: Any modifications to an MS while an associated msmd tool is open will not be reflected in the msmd tool. You must close and reopen the tool if you want to capture changes made to metadata of an MS if such a change occurs.
\begin{verbatim} Example:
msmd.open("3C273XC1.MS") # get the number of spectral windows nspw = msmd.nspw() msmd.done() \end{verbatim} We open the tool by querying the MS for its metadata. We then get the number of spectral windows in the dataset and close the tool.

method.name: almaspws
method.shortdescription: Get a list of spectral window IDs with ALMA-specific attributes.

param.name: chavg
param.description: Get channel average spectral windows?

param.name: fdm
param.description: Get FDM spectral windows?

param.name: sqld
param.description: Get square law (i.e. total power) detector spectral windows?

param.name: tdm
param.description: Get TDM spectral windows?

param.name: wvr
param.description: Get WVR spectral windows?

param.name: complement
param.description: Return the complement of the selected set?

method.description: Get spectral window IDs based on ALMA-specific criteria. The inputs are or'ed together to form the returned list. If complement=True, then the complement of the selection is returned.
method.example: msmd.open("my.ms") # get all square law detector spectral window IDs msmd.almaspws(sqld=True) # get all spectral window IDs other than those associated with square law detectors msmd.almaspws(sqld=True, complement=True)

method.name: antennaids
method.shortdescription: Get the zero-based antenna ID for the specfied antenna name.

param.name: name
param.description: Antenna names (string or string array) for which to get the corresponding IDs. Note that * matches any number of characters of all character classes.

param.name: mindiameter
param.description: Minimum antenna diameter, expressed as a quantity.

param.name: maxdiameter
param.description: Maximum antenna diameter, expressed as a quantity.

method.description: Get the zero-based antenna IDs for the specfied antenna names and the specified diameter range. An array of unique IDs in order of the specified names is returned. If no names and no diameter range is specified, all IDs are returned.
method.example: msmd.open("my.ms") # get the zero-based antenna IDs for the antenna named "VB2" antenna_id = msmd.antennaids("VB2")[0] # get the zero-based antenna IDs for all antennas with diameters between 9m and 11m antenna_ids = msmd.antennaids(mindiameter="9m", maxdiameter=qa.quantity("11m")) msmd.done()

method.name: antennaoffset
method.shortdescription: Get the offset position of the specified antenna relative to the array reference position.

param.name: which
param.description: Zero-based antenna in the ANTENNA table.

method.description: Get the offset position of the specified antenna relative to the array reference position. Antenna may be specified as a zero-based integer (row number in the ANTENNA table) or a string representing a valid antenna name. The returned record contains the longitude, latitude, and elevation offsets as quantity records. The reported longitude and latitude offsets are measured along the surface of a sphere whose center is coincident with the center of the earth and whose surface contains the observatory reference position.
method.example: msmd.open("my.ms") # get the offset of the (zero-based) 3rd antenna in the ANTENNA table antennna_offset = msmd.antennaoffset(3) # get the offset of antenna DV02 antennna_offset = msmd.antennaoffset('DV02') msmd.done()

param.description: Zero-based antenna ID in the ANTENNA table or antenna name.

method.example: msmd.open("my.ms") # get the position of the (zero-based) 3rd antenna in the ANTENNA table antennna_position = msmd.antennaposition(3) # get the position of the antenna named DV07 antennna_position = msmd.antennaposition("DV07") msmd.done()

method.name: effexposuretime
method.shortdescription: Get the effective exposure (on-source integration time)
method.description:
Get the effective exposure time (equivalent to what might be more commonly known as total integration time or total sample time) is calculated by summing over all rows in the main MS table, excluding autocorrelations or rows where FLAG\_ROW is false, thusly:
sum[over i] (exposure[i]*sum[over j](UFBW[i, j])/ncorrelations[i] )/ nmaxbaselines
where exposure[i] is the value of EXPOSURE for the ith row, the inner sum is performed over each correlation for that row, UFBW is the unflagged fractional bandwidth is determined by summing all the widths of the unflagged channels for that correlation and dividing by the total bandwidth of all spectral windows observed at the timestamp of row i, ncorrelations is the number of correlations determined by the number of rows in the FLAG matrix for MS row i, and nmaxbaselines is the maximum number of antenna pairs, nantennas*(nantennas-1)/2, where nantennas is the number of antennas in the ANTENNA table. This method returns a quantity (a dictionary having a numerical value and a string unit).
method.example: msmd.open("my.ms") # get the effective exposure time. exposure_time = msmd.effexposuretime() msmd.done()

method.name: exposuretime
method.shortdescription: Get the exposure time for the specified scan, spwid, and polarizaiton ID.

param.name: scan
param.description: Scan number.

param.name: spwid
param.description: Spectral window ID.

param.name: polid
param.description: Polarization ID.

method.description: Get the exposure time for the specified scan, spwid, and polarizaiton ID. This is the exposure time of the record with the lowest time stamp of the records associated with these parameters. Returns a quantity dictionary.
method.example: msmd.open("my.ms") # get the exposure time for scan 1, spwid 2, and polid 3 integration_time = msmd.getexposuretime(scan=1, spwid=2, polid=3) msmd.done()
